item.title: github: Codespaces is now in public preview for GitHub Enterprise with data residency
item.description:
GitHub Codespaces is now in public preview for GitHub Enterprise Cloud with data residency, enabling secure, configurable, instantly available cloud development environments while helping organizations meet strict compliance requirements.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Copilot metrics in GitHub Enterprise Cloud with data residency in public preview
item.description:
GitHub announced that Copilot metrics — including usage data, code generation dashboards, and a metrics API — are available in public preview for GitHub Enterprise Cloud customers with data residency, enabling organizations to store and query Copilot metrics according to regional compliance requirements.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: security: How Microsoft builds privacy and security to work hand-in-hand
item.description:
The article describes how Microsoft aligns privacy and security initiatives, using advanced tools and adherence to global compliance standards to protect customer data and foster trust.

  • Source: Microsoft Security Blog

item.title: github: GitHub Enterprise Cloud data residency in Japan is generally available
item.description:
GitHub Enterprise Cloud data residency in Japan is now generally available, letting Enterprise Cloud customers choose to store their code and repository data in Japan to support compliance, privacy, and performance needs.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: FIPS compliant mode for Application Gateway V2 SKUs
item.description:
Azure Application Gateway V2 SKUs are now generally available with a FIPS 140-2 compliant mode, allowing customers to use FIPS-validated cryptographic modules to help meet US government and regulatory cryptography requirements.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: github: Enterprise bring your own key (BYOK) for GitHub Copilot is now in public preview
item.description:
GitHub announced that Enterprise Bring Your Own Key (BYOK) for GitHub Copilot is now in public preview. The feature responds to enterprise demand for greater flexibility, enabling teams that already use specific LLM providers or custom models to integrate those workflows with Copilot.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Azure VNet Flow Log - Filtering
item.description:
Azure announced a Public Preview that adds advanced filtering capabilities to VNet Flow Logs, which capture IP traffic through VNets, subnets, and NICs to support monitoring, troubleshooting, network optimization, security, and compliance.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Azure SQL Database long-term retention (LTR) backup immutability
item.description:
Azure SQL Database now generally supports immutability for long-term retention (LTR) backups. When immutability is enabled, LTR backups cannot be modified or deleted until their configured retention period expires, helping organizations meet compliance and protect backups from deletion or ransomware.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Built-in CIS benchmarks for Azure endorsed Linux distros in Machine Config
item.description:
Azure Machine Configuration now offers built-in CIS benchmarks in public preview for all Azure-endorsed Linux distributions via a new customizable security benchmarks capability powered by azure-osconfig.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Enterprise MCP enhancements in Foundry Agent Service
item.description:
Microsoft Foundry (Foundry Agent Service) now supports enhanced Enterprise MCP integration in public preview, enabling secure, authenticated connections that let credentials be passed to MCP servers securely to improve flexibility, security, and compliance.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Microsoft Foundry Control Plane & Entra Agent ID
item.description:
Microsoft has announced a public preview of Microsoft Foundry Control Plane and Entra Agent ID, a unified platform for enterprise AI agent observability, security, and governance. The Control Plane combines identity, monitoring, and compliance capabilities to provide centralized control, deep observability, and regulatory alignment for AI agents.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Streamline IT governance, security, and cost management experiences with Microsoft Foundry
item.description:
Microsoft Foundry’s enterprise features are now generally available, providing IT administrators tools to streamline AI development and management while enforcing enterprise-grade security, compliance, governance, and cost controls.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Vaulted Backup for Azure Data Lake Storage (ADLS)
item.description:
Azure Backup’s vaulted protection for ADLS Gen2 is now generally available, providing secure, off‑site, independent backups of Data Lake Storage to help organizations meet resilience and compliance requirements.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: github: GitHub Enterprise Cloud with data residency now supports Visual Studio subscriptions
item.description:
GitHub Enterprise Cloud with data residency now supports Visual Studio subscriptions, letting organizations use GitHub Enterprise features via Visual Studio subscriptions while keeping data stored in chosen regions for compliance. The support applies to both subscription-based and usage-based (metered) GitHub Enterprise plans.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: security: ​​Securing critical infrastructure: Why Europe’s risk-based regulations matter
item.description:
The article explains how new European Union risk-based legislation helps CISOs strengthen cybersecurity for critical infrastructure by encouraging organizations to assess and prioritize risks, align controls with regulatory expectations, and build more resilient systems.

  • Source: Microsoft Security Blog

item.title: k8s: Spotlight on Policy Working Group
item.description: The Policy Working Group (now completed) worked to standardize and simplify policy management across the Kubernetes ecosystem. Led by co-chairs Jim Bugwadia, Poonam Lamba, and Andy Suderman, the group produced documentation, whitepapers, a CNCF survey, and the Policy Reports API, and helped educate the community about built-in policy APIs and CNCF policy tools. The WG coordinated with SIG Auth and SIG Security, faced contributor-time and consensus challenges, and encouraged newcomers to join meetings and review materials to get involved.

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Locations API Update for UK Azure Regions
item.description:
Azure has updated the Locations API metadata for UK-based regions by changing the geographyGroup and regionalDisplayName fields to meet evolving compliance and regulatory requirements. The changes are in effect October 2025.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Introducing Vaulted Backup for Azure Data Lake Storage
item.description:
Microsoft announced the Public Preview of Vaulted Backup for Azure Data Lake Storage (ADLS). Azure Backup now supports vaulted protection for ADLS, providing secure off‑site backups to help ensure business continuity and compliance and to protect data from accidental deletion.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Vaulted backup for Azure Files (Premium)
item.description:
Azure Backup now offers generally available vaulted backups for Azure Files premium shares, providing vault-based protection to help ensure business continuity and compliance.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: github: Delegated bypass controls for push protection now available at the enterprise level
item.description:
GitHub now offers delegated bypass controls for push protection at the enterprise level. Administrators can choose who is allowed to bypass secret-scanning push protections and designate reviewers for bypass requests, centrally managing approvers to improve governance and reduce risk.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Enterprise access restrictions with corporate proxies is now generally available
item.description:
GitHub announced general availability of enterprise access restrictions using corporate proxies for GitHub Enterprise Cloud accounts that use Enterprise Managed Users (EMU). Enterprise owners can now enforce access controls tied to corporate proxy infrastructure to improve security and compliance for managed enterprise identities.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: terraform: Policy as code, explained
item.description:
Policy as code automates the verification of compliance with IT and business requirements during infrastructure deployments, providing rapid checks within minutes or seconds.

  • Source: Terraform
